title: Kevin Hart will 'not sue driver or file insurance claim' over car crash that left him injured
text:
Comedian Kevin Hart will reportedly not sue or file an insurance claim against Jared Black, whom the California Highway Patrol concluded crashed Kevin's 1970 Plymouth Barracuda in Calabasas on September 1.

A source told TMZ that the 40-year-old Grammy nominee decided so because he 'likes' 28-year-old Jared and his fiancée Rebecca Broxterman is the beloved trainer of his second wife Eniko Parrish.

'I have nothing but love for Jared and wish him and Rebecca a speedy recovery,' the Hobbs & Shaw actor said in a statement earlier this month.

Comedian Kevin Hart (L) will reportedly not sue or file an insurance claim against Jared Black (R), whom the California Highway Patrol concluded crashed Kevin's 1970 Plymouth Barracuda in Calabasas on September 1

However, the site reported that Black - who suffered serious back and chest injuries - might still sue Hart for not equipping his restored muscle car with proper seat belts.

There was previously confusion over who was driving the vintage vehicle as the 911 caller said he saw 'Kevin's security guard remove him through the driver's side window' after it careened off Mulholland Drive.

The funny father-of-three is receiving outpatient intensive physical therapy following his surgery for three spinal fractures, and he was last spotted walking inside Beverly Hills restaurant Avra on October 21.

'You wouldn't know he had been in a serious accident by the looks of things. He was happy to be out and having fun,' an eyewitness told E! News.

'Kevin was in great spirits. He was fist bumping his friends [Jay-Z, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Rich Paul] and giving them hugs when he arrived [to the private poker match].'

But fans shouldn't expect the Philadelphia native to attend the People's Choice Awards - airing November 10 on E! - where he's nominated for comedy act, comedy movie star, and animated movie star.

Kevin is expected to only do minimal promotion for Jumanji: The Next Level - hitting UK/US theaters December 13 - in which he reprises his role as zoologist Franklin 'Mouse' Finbar.

Hart - who will reportedly return to work 'next year' - hasn't posted anything for his 139.3M social media following since a 'happy to be home' poolside snap on August 31.
